definition[0]: to damage or injure something badly by crushing or twisting it
example[0]: The trap closed round her leg, badly mangling her ankle.
definition[1]: to spoil something such as a speech or piece of music, by saying or playing it badly
example[1]: The orchestra had mangled Bachâ€™s music.
definition[2]: a machine used in former times to remove water from washed clothes by pressing them between two rollers
